alert.note: Alert for De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 02 at 6:04PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN LINCOLN...SOUTH CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL...SOUTHWESTERN DE BACA AND GUADALUPE COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM MDT... At 603 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Anton Chico to 15 miles west of Ramon. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Santa Rosa, Vaughn, Colonias, Yeso, Pastura, Puerto De Luna, Santa Rosa Lake State Park, Ramon, and Pintada. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 243 and 285. Highway 285 between Mile Markers 169 and 204. Highway 60 between Mile Markers 272 and 313. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for central, northeastern and east central New Mexico.

area.areaDesc: De Baca County; Eastern Lincoln County; Guadalupe County
